Key Arguments: The legislation threatens free speech and could lead to a form of tyranny.
Government control over information is undemocratic and reminiscent of totalitarian regimes.
Australians are capable of discerning truth from misinformation without government intervention.
Notable Quotes: Criminalising free speech, no matter how horrible that speech might be, is wrong.

A government that appoints itself as the sole authority and voice of truth of information is not new, it has been practised in many countries over history under communism, fascism and totalitarian regimes.
NO, we don’t need a Ministry of Truth, NO, we don’t want unelected bureaucrats to control, manipulate or manage in any form the information Australians have the right to access.
